column5: Trying to break the record.....Close but no cigar. http://www.buffalonews.com/city/communities/aurora-east-aurora/article358672.ece
You're delusional, nothing better than an old school salt water fish fry, with skin...

I'll eat it either way.....doesn't matter to me......at one time "Yellow Pike" (walleye) and "Blue Pike" dinners out sold haddock 10 - 1. But now every tavern here only sells haddock dinners because "yellow pike" is to darn expensive compared to haddock....but haddock is now selling for a average of $9.99 per dinner....it wasn't too long ago a fish fry was only $4.99 to $5.99 per dinner.  The Friday fish fry tradition at your local tavern is alive and well in the Buffalo area....one of the few traditions that has survived....
Good stuff, Bob. It's the kind of thing I'd get involved with. Might even get one happening here.
